ygData.subject: Re: [archive-crawler] Crawler warning: beyond expected limit 125000000(in processor Scheduler)
ygData.msgSnippet: The message we emit when beyond the upper bound for the bloom filter changed between 1.6 and 1.8 Joe. Here is the commit message with explication of change

The message we emit when beyond the upper bound for the bloom filter 
changed between 1.6 and 1.8 Joe.

Here is the commit message with explication of change (FYI, around here, 
Igor always gets whatever he wants):

----------------------------
revision 1.7
date: 2006/08/11 06:07:17;  author: gojomo;  state: Exp;  lines: +6 -8
By Igor's request, fewer bloom-overflow warnings
* BloomUriUniqFilter.java
    issue single warning when exceeding 'expected_n' of bloom (not one 
warning every 10K inserts)


Here is the relevant part of the diff. You're one of the few who might 
be familiar with the old emission considering you're sole member, at 
least as far as we know, of the billion+ club.

 >  * @version $Date: 2006/08/11 06:07:17 $, $Revision: 1.7 $
134,139c134,137
<         // check if bloom is operating past expected range (and thus
<         // giving more false indications a string was already contained
<         // than was intended); if so, offer a warning on every 10000th
<         // increment
<         if( added && (count() > expected_n) && (count() % 10000 == 0)) {
<             LOGGER.warning(count()+" beyond expected limit "+expected_n);
---
 >         // warn if bloom has reached its expected size (and its false-pos
 >         // rate will now exceed the theoretical/designed level)
 >         if( added && (count() == expected_n)) {
 >             LOGGER.warning("Bloom has reached expected limit 
"+expected_n);


St.Ack


joehung302 wrote:
>
> What does this mean? I'm using 1.8. I didn't see this warning in 1.6.
>
> Thanks,
> -Joe
>
>
